page.title: 14Longshaw Lodge
page.content: Longshaw Lodge was originally part of the Longshaw Estate and was used as a shooting lodge by the Duke of Rutland. The whole Estate comprising 11533 Acres were put up for sale by auction in July 1927 without restrictions. The prospectus for the sale advertised the Parklands as suitable for a Golf Course and the woodland as affording several "Beautifully placed building sites". A joint committee of the Sheffield council of Social Services and the Sheffield Asscociation for the Protection of Local Scenery resolved to purchase Longshaw Lodge and its grounds of 747 acres, upon the paymaent of Â£13000 raised by bank overdraught. The repayment of this was achieved by public subscription. This made possible the conveyance of the Estate on 25th March 1931 to the National Trust.
